profileText: A Representative from Pennsylvania; born in Philadelphia, Pa., January 4, 1780; attended a classical school in Bordentown, N.J., three years; was graduated from Harvard University in 1797; studied law; was admitted to the bar and commenced practice in Philadelphia in 1800; member of the State house of representatives in 1806 and 1807; between 1807 and 1814 prepared and published six volumes of reported decisions of the supreme court of Pennsylvania; director of the United States Bank; elected as an Anti-Jacksonian to the Twenty-third Congress (March 4, 1833-March 3, 1835); was not a candidate for renomination in 1834; except for his appearance before the supreme court in 1844 as counsel for Philadelphia in the Girard will case, he retired from his practice in the courts and confined himself to giving written opinions; died in Philadelphia, Pa., August 12, 1875; interment in St. James the Less Cemetery, Falls of the Schuylkill (now a part of Philadelphia), Pa.

researchRecord.name: 1822, 1 item.
researchRecord.description: A letter from Horace Binney to L. Cheves written on September 28, 1822. In the letter, Horace Binney writes that he will make an arrangement with the counsel of the Schuylkill Bank for convening the referees.

recordLocation.name: Department of Literary and Historical Manuscripts

researchRecord.name: 1869, 1 item.
researchRecord.description: A letter from Horace Binney to Brantz Mayer written on January 19, 1869. In the letter, Horace Binney sends Brantz Mayer legal publications.

recordLocation.name: Department of Literary and Historical Manuscripts

researchRecord.name: In the Nicholas Biddle papers, 1681-1933, 39.2 linear feet.
researchRecord.description: Correspondents include Horace Binney. A finding aid is available in the library.

researchRecord.name: 1861-1867, 2 items.
researchRecord.description: Correspondence between Horace Binney and Henry Charles Lea.

researchRecord.name: In the Bank of the United States (1816-1836) Letters and Minutes, 1819-1842, 3 volumes.
ca. 1836-1858, 11 volumes.
researchRecord.description: The collection of Horace Binney includes a travel journal (1836-1837), commonplace book (1858), autobiography, essays, and genealogical notes.

researchRecord.name: In the Bidwell Family papers, ca. 1750-1952, 7 linear feet.
researchRecord.description: Persons represented include Horace Binney. An unpublished finding aid is available in the repository.

researchRecord.name: In the Chauncey Family papers, 1675-1928, 8 linear feet.
researchRecord.description: Persons represented include Horace Binney. An unpublished finding aid is available in the repository.

researchRecord.name: In the General Collection Manuscript Miscellany, 1823, 1 item.
researchRecord.description: A letter from Horace Binney to Richard W. Meade written on April 25, 1823.

researchRecord.name: In the General Collection Manuscript Miscellany, ca. 1840, 1 item.
researchRecord.description: A letter from Horace Binney to A. N. Skinner. The letter is a fragment with a signature.

researchRecord.name: In the General Collection Manuscript Miscellany, n.d., 2 items.
researchRecord.description: Two letter fragments from Horace Binney consisting of closing lines and signatures. The fragments form part of the Daggett autograph collection.

researchRecord.name: In the John Collins Warren correspondence, 1812-1854, 37 items.
researchRecord.description: Persons represented include Horace Binney. A list of the items is available in the repository.

researchRecord.name: In the Woolsey Family papers, ca. 1750-1950, 38 linear feet.
researchRecord.description: Persons represented include Horace Binney. An unpublished finding aid is available in the repository.

researchRecord.name: 1827, 1 page.
researchRecord.description: A letter from Horace Binney to Ion Meredith written on April 19, 1827. In the letter, Horace Binney writes concerning a proposed compromise in a legal matter.

researchRecord.name: 1852, 1 item.
researchRecord.description: A letter from Joseph Gales to Horace Binney written on August 3, 1852. In the letter, Joseph Gales is directed to American State Papers to locate a document dated October 1818.

researchRecord.name: 1828-1844, 3 items.
researchRecord.description: Letters from Horace Binney to J. Meredith, lawyer in Baltimore, and J. Cowperthwaite at the 2nd Appeals Court in Philadelphia, mostly on legal matters. The first letter, dated June 21, 1844, conveys Horace Binney's hope that a publication which J. Meredith is involved with will do some good, especially in Maryland and Virginia. The second letter, dated Jan. 2, 1834, asks J. Cowperthwaite for financial statements. The third letter, dated Oct. 4, 1828, asks J. Meredith for information on the progress of a case and urges him to do all he can for it.

researchRecord.name: 1843, 1 item.
researchRecord.description: A letter from Horace Binney to [Abraham?] Hart written on December 1, 1843.

researchRecord.name: ca. 1844, 1 item.
researchRecord.description: A letter from Horace Binney to Morton M'Michael written on March 20, 1844. In the letter, Horace Binney writes on advertizing the sale of stocks and loans associated with a legal case.
